  Our Faculty                                                                                                                               Bachelor of Science                                                             Master of Social Work                                                             PhD Program                                                             DSW Program                                                             Admissions Events                                                                                                                    Admissions                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       The Silver School of Social Work provides a rich environment for the education of professional social workers—offering undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral degrees—with a curriculum that reflects current knowledge from both research and practice. With a commitment to social justice, an emphasis on research, and a long history of excellent clinical training, the School provides a strong education for the next generation of social workers. A Silver School degree will go beyond the essentials of social work eduction—it offers an extensive array of advanced and elective courses that deepens knowledge and training in one, or several, specialty areas. As part of NYU's Global Network University, the Silver School offers several global learning options to students in all degree programs. The School’s BS and MSW programs are fully accredited by the Council on Social Work Education.     All MSW programs offered by the School are available on the main campus at Washington Square. In addition, we have two suburban campus sites—in Rockland and Westchester Counties—to make learning more accessible to MSW students living in the tri-state area. An MSW program at Shanghai and New York will start in fall 2015.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Contact Us                                                                                                   MSW Program:     silver.admissions@nyu.edu or 212-998-5910       PhD Program:     silver.phd@nyu.edu or  212-998-5941        DSW Program:   silver.dsw@nyu.edu or  212-998-4352     BS Program:   silver.bs@nyu.edu or  212-998-5966                                                                                                                                                                                                          Download an MSW Viewbook                                                                                                                                       Obtain graduate program information                                                                                            We are dedicated to continued excellence in education for clinical practice, social justice, and leadership for the future of social work. We are passionate about teaching, and we view students as vital partners in our educational programs. Produce a groundbreaking documentary that gives others a new point of entry on a global issue such as poverty. Inspire high school students to develop their imagination through literature.     Humanities and social sciences provide you with a set of skills for a broad range of professional fields, including business, communication, education, law, medicine, politics, and psychology, among others. In NYU’s undergraduate programs in the humanities and social sciences, you gain a solid liberal arts foundation, detailed exploration of the theoretical aspects of your field, hands-on professional experience, and the opportunity to study at other locations in the global network.     Listed in the thematic groupings below are the academic programs in the Humanities and Social Sciences.
